manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Rii RM100+ Wireless Mouse 1000 DPI for PC, Laptop, Windows,Office Included Wireless USB dongle Quickview 1.This small size (9.96*6.3*3.63cm) mice is portable, light for taking to anywhere, also, it is best for kids using when online lessons at home.:) 2.When you get this mouse first time ,please get 2*AAA battery first.Not battery coming with the mice. 3. The usb receiver is in the battery jar. Open the back cover you will see it. 4.Specification Type: Wireless mouse Wireless Distance: 10m Receiver: Nano receiver Colors: Black Buttons:3 DPI:1000 5. Package details : Wireless mouse x1 USB nano receiver x1

Handy Size, Ergonomic Design Rii Mini wireless mouse is handy size, comfortable and responsive. Avoid fatigue from long time working. Also it’s convenient to carry around. 3,000,000 Times Click Durable and less noise, increase working efficiency. Getting more focus on working.1000DPI meet working demands. Plug&Play,Blue receiver Marked Easy to Find Plug and play, no need to install any software, easy to set up. Just take off the USB receiver(in the battery slot) and plug into your PC. It comes with blue usb receiver ,it is marked and easy to find.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I needed
reviews.reviewText: Arrived on time, works great, great price. no complaints

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Mouse Ever!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this mouse back in Feb 22, 2021. This mouse has traveled with me for work to at least 10 diff countries at this point. It has been packed in tight spaces, tossed, dropped etc. I love that it uses 2 AAA batteries. In the 2 years that I’ve had this mouse I’ve only ever changed the batteries on this thing TWICE!!!!! The only times I will turn my mouse off is when I am packing it up for travel. I’m finally buying the same mouse because it randomly stopped functioning for me ): (pretty sure it was my glass of water that spilled everywhere yesterday that may have done it.)I’ve looked through Amazon for at least 2 hours just now trying to find a “better” mouse but none compare. ESPECIALLY for the price!!So if you’re weary of buying a cheap, but cute, pink mouse. Definitely go for it! (Also this is the same seller I bought my mouse from 2 years ago)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sleep mode is a BIG PLUS
reviews.reviewText: This mouse is obviously made across the street from the "wireless mouse factory" in China. Cheap plastic, knockoff design, the laziest patent avoidance. But, it's a mouse. I don't care about all that. It goes click good and I can use it on my PC. Scroll wheel works fine - is also a button. It is missing 2 extra buttons that will go forward or back on a page....but, I always accidentally click these buttons so the fact they are NOT PRESENT on the mouse is another plus. Also the sleep mode means I don't have to worry about clicking off my mouse or else my batter is dead. Also, the sleep mode isn't so fast where you find yourself having to wake up the mouse all the time. THE PERFECT SLEEP TIMER. A+ mouse. The boys in China over at the "Rii" factory are churning out a winner. I recommend this mouse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars You get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I needed something quick and Inexpensive. Delivery was smooth and arrived on expected delivery date. Mouse itself is very lightweight and made of plastic. Uses 2 AA batteries not included with mouse. Haven’t experienced any lagging. Mouse turns off automatically on standby and clicking the mouse wakes it up so not draining batteries when not in use which is a plus. Only downside is I’ve had it for give or take 2 weeks now and with minimal use the left clicker has already gotten stuck maybe 2 times. Also, the battery compartment door is not so easy to open and close. I can tell it won’t last long but it’s getting the job done so far and cost only 5 bucks so .. you get what you pay for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quick plug In..
reviews.reviewText: Great Mouse for under $6. Easy to set up, Just put the adapter in put the battery's in.. Turn On

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent Mouse for the Price, But Some Annoyances
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased this mouse for gaming, and overall, I think it's a decent deal considering the price point. However, there are a few aspects that caught me off guard.First off, let's talk about the functionality. The mouse does what it's supposed to do – it's responsive and works well for basic tasks. I appreciate that, especially given the affordable price. However, I wish the product description had clearly stated that the mouse requires two AA batteries to function. When I initially tried to use it and it didn't work, I was quite frustrated. It was only after some investigation that I realized the issue was with the batteries. So, if you're considering buying this mouse, keep in mind that you'll need to have two AA batteries on hand.Another point worth mentioning is the design. The mouse itself has a simple and functional design, but I did run into a challenge when trying to insert the batteries. The back panel is extremely difficult to open; in fact, I had to resort to using a knife to pry it open. This is something that could definitely be improved upon, as it's not the most user-friendly experience.Considering the price, I don't want to be overly critical. At the end of the day, it's a $5 mouse, and it does its job reasonably well. Yes, there are some inconveniences like the battery requirement and the challenging back panel, but these are somewhat expected at this price range. It's a basic mouse that gets the job done, just be prepared for a couple of minor hurdles. If you're looking for an affordable option and are willing to overlook these small issues, then this mouse might suit your needs.It's not without its quirks, but if you're on a tight budget and just need a functional mouse, it's a viable choice. Just remember to have some AA batteries handy and be patient with the back panel as it can break easily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Its a mouse and it works
reviews.reviewText: When my computer goes into sleep, so does the mouse. I love that. Battery life seems to be very good. Mouse is small and it works great. This is a good bargain.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Spend the extra $4 for the Logitech
reviews.reviewText: Cons:1) They're noticeably cheap and flimsy compared to the Logitech.2) Only one mouse out of the two pack i bought was usable, and it had a hard time tracking smoothly on my desk's reflective white surface. The Logitech had no such problems.3) The on/off switch looked and felt like a micro–DIP switch - the kind you have to scrape on/off with a paperclip.4) As with the Logitech, the mouse turns itself off after sitting for a few minutes. Unlike the Logi, however, you must scrape the on/off switch off, then back to on to use it again. The Logi wakes up by simply moving it.5) The mouse uses a red LED sensor that's bright enough to light up a basketball size spot on my wall from 3 feet away. The Logi users an infrared laser sensor that's invisible.6) The mouse takes two AAA batteries to power it's bright red LED whereas the Logitech takes a single AA battery.Pros:1) It's cheap.Conclusion: Spend the extra $4 to get the Logitech.
Takes 2 AAA batteries and without needing to manually switch off, it turns off by itself thus saving battery. Tracking is smooth and clicks work great. Exactly what I wanted.
a reasonal cheaper brand of wireless mouse, does its job very well in the close space where i am operating at... well great purchase...tls
Good, solid build quality for a mouse that cheap
